summary: Email correspondence regarding the FBI's delivery of two new drives from an Assistant United States Attorney's office to the Metropolitan Detention Center for Ghislaine Maxwell. The email chain involves coordination between the AUSA, an FBI Special Agent, and MDC staff for the delivery on January 11, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of two new drives being delivered to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) by the FBI.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the initial email coordinating the delivery of drives to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC, cc'ing an FBI Special Agent.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Coordinating the delivery of the drives from the AUSA's office to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Working together to coordinate delivery of evidence/drives to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC.
Prosecutor involved in case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, arranging delivery of materials to her.
FBI agent coordinating delivery of drives to defendant Ghislaine Maxwell at detention center.

events.title: FBI Drive Delivery to MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI delivers two new drives from the AUSA's office to the Metropolitan Detention Center for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI coordinated delivery of two new drives to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center on January 11, 2021.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York initiated the delivery coordination.
The email shows ongoing legal proceedings and evidence handling in the Ghislaine Maxwell case in early 2021.
Communication involves multiple parties: AUSA, FBI Special Agent, and MDC staff for logistical coordination.
The document demonstrates procedural aspects of evidence transfer to a high-profile federal detainee.
